rules_content:
The objective is to implement a forest fire propagation simulation.
Estimated duration of the exercise: about 2/3 hours.
The forest is represented by a grid of dimensions h x l.
The temporal dimension is discretized, so the simulation progresses step by step.
In the initial state, one or more cells are on fire.
If a cell is on fire at time t, then at time t+1:
- The fire extinguishes in that cell (the cell is filled with ashes and can no longer burn).
- and there is a probability p that the fire spreads to each of the 4 adjacent cells.
The simulation stops when there are no more cells on fire.
The dimensions of the grid, the position of the cells initially on fire, as well as the probability of propagation, are parameters of the program stored in a configuration file (free format).
What interests us is not just to see a simulation program with the best GUI, but above all to understand:
- How you approach a problem
- How you code
- What your architectural choices are
- How you present your work once completed.
